meanings.definition: Of or relating to a siphon.
meanings.sent1: The siphonal tube helped move the water smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The siphonal design made it easy to transfer liquids.
meanings.sent3: The siphonal shape of the hose made it look like a curly straw.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back in a siphonal flow.
meanings.sent5: The siphonal structure of the bridge allowed for efficient drainage.

meanings.sent1: The siphonal bottles were used for dispensing drinks.
meanings.sent2: The siphonal mechanism helped in emptying the tank quickly.
meanings.sent3: The siphonal setup in the lab looked like a science experiment.
meanings.sent4: His words had a siphonal effect, drawing attention away from the main issue.
meanings.sent5: The siphonal pipes were essential for the irrigation system.

meanings.sent1: The siphonal shape of the shell was unique.
meanings.sent2: The siphonal pattern on the fabric was eye-catching.
meanings.sent3: The siphonal appearance of the vase gave it an elegant touch.
meanings.sent4: Her dress flowed in a siphonal manner as she walked.
meanings.sent5: The clouds had a siphonal look as they stretched across the sky.
